parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for customers with an address in the United States, the where parameter will be country='United States'. When this parameter is omitted, all customers are returned in a paginated fashion. Supported fields are those that are non-metadata. For instance, first_name is supported, but last_order_id is not supported. It is possible to search by Customer ID as well, for example with id='1234'.

parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The number of results to fetch in a given page. When this parameter is omitted, a maximum of 200 results are returned.

parameters.description: Optionally return orders in a particular order. Current supported values are 'updated_at' and 'last_order_date'. By default this returns in ascending order, for descending order use 'updated_at desc'.

parameters.description: Optionally return the total count of customers. Returned in response headers.

get.summary:
Returns a list of objects based on a set of search parameters.  Here is an example query:  select id, name			(Fields of that Object)
from contactX			(Name of Object)
where name like '%foo%' 	(Search Expression)
or name like '%bar%;		(Search Expression continued)
order by createdDate 		(Order of Search)
limit 10 			(How Many Results to Display)
offset 0 			(Where to start in the list of objects)
In this example, I am querying a list of objects from contactX containing the fields id and name where the name contains foo or bar.  The results will be in a list of 10 organized by the date they were created, starting with the earliest.

phone.description: The customer's phone number for this mailing address

province_code.description: The two-letter pcode for the customer's province or state

zip.description: The customer's zip or postal code

latitude.description: The latitude of the billing address

longitude.description: The longitude of the billing address

height.description: Height dimension of the image which is determined on upload

Customer.description: A customer resource instance represents a customer account with the shop.

accepts_marketing.description: Indicates whether the customer has consented to be sent marketing material via email. Valid values are true or false

addresses.description: A list of the ten most recently updated addresses for the customer

created_at.description: The date and time when the customer was created.The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format

default_address.description: The default address for the customer

email.description: The unique email address of the customer. Attempting to assign the same email address to multiple customers will return an error

metafields.description: Attaches additional metadata to a shop's resources

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the customer

last_order_id.description: The id of the customer's last order

last_order_name.description: The name of the customer's last order. This is directly related to the Order's name field

orders_count.description: The number of orders associated with this customer

multipass_identifier.description: The customer's identifier used with Multipass login

phone.description: The unique phone number for this customer. Attempting to assign the same phone number to multiple customers will return an error

tax_exempt.description: Indicates whether the customer should be charged taxes when placing orders. Valid values are true or false

verified_email.description: States whether or not the email address has been verified

OrderClientDetails.description: An object containing information about the client

browser_height.description: The browser screen height in pixels, if available

browser_width.description: The browser screen width in pixels, if available

AbandonedCheckout.description: A checkout is considered abandoned when a customer has entered their billing & shipping info, but has yet to complete the purchase

cancel_reason.description: The reason why the order was cancelled. If the order was not cancelled, this value is null.If the order was cancelled, the value will be one of the customer,fraud,inventory,other

closed_at.description: The date and time when the order was closed.If the order was not closed, this value is null

abandoned_checkout_url.description: The full recovery URL to be sent to a customer to recover their abandoned checkout

billing_address.description: The mailing address associated with the payment method

buyer_accepts_marketing.description: Indicates whether or not the person who placed the order would like to receive email updates from the shop

customer.description: An object containing information about the customer

items.description: Applicable discount codes that can be applied to the order. If no codes exist the value will default to blank

landing_site.description: The URL for the page where the buyer landed when entering the shop

line_items.description: A list of line item objects, each one containing information about an item in the order

note.description: The text of an optional note that a shop owner can attach to the order

referring_site.description: The website that the customer clicked on to come to the shop

shipping_address.description: The mailing address to where the order will be shipped

shipping_lines.description: An array of shipping_line objects, each of which details the shipping methods used

subtotal_price.description: Price of the order before shipping and taxes

tax_lines.description: An array of tax_line objects, each of which details the taxes applicable to the order

token.description: Unique identifier for a particular order

total_discounts.description: The total amount of the discounts to be applied to the price of the order

total_line_items_price.description: The sum of all the prices of all the items in the order

total_price.description: The sum of all the prices of all the items in the order, taxes and discounts included

total_tax.description: The sum of all the taxes applied to the line items in the order

total_weight.description: The sum of all the weights of the line items in the order, in grams

updated_at.description: Date and time when the checkout was updated. ISO 8601 format (ex: 2008-01-10T11:00:00-05:00).

ordersRisks.description: The Order risk assessment is used to indicate to a merchant the fraud checks that have been done on an order

recommendation.description: The recommended action given to the merchant

score.description: A number between 0 and 1 indicating percentage likelihood of being fraud

source.description: This indicates the source of the risk assessment

Order.description: An order is a customer's completed request to purchase one or more products from a shop. An order is created when a customer completes the checkout process, during which time they provide an email address or phone number, billing address and payment information

refunds.description: The list of refunds applied to the order

payment_gateway_names.description: The list of all payment gateways used for the order

note_attributes.description: Extra information that is added to the order. Each array entry must contain a hash with name and value keys

buyer_accepts_marketing.description: Indicates whether the person who placed the order would like to receive email updates from the shop. This is set when the customer selects the Submit to our newsletter checkbox during checkout. The store's settings about email marketing don't affect this value

created_at.description: This auto-generated property is the date and time when the order was created in Shopify, in ISO 8601 format

currency.description: The three letter code (ISO 4217) for the currency used for the payment.

customer.description: An object containing information about the customer. It is important to note that the order may not have a customer and consumers should not depend on the existence of a customer object. This value may be null if the order was created through Shopify POS

discount_codes.description: Applicable discount codes that can be applied to the order

id.description: The unique numeric identifier for the order. This one is used for API purposes.This is different from the order_number property

line_items.description: A list of line item objects, each one containing information about an item in the order

name.description: The customer's order name as represented by a number.

number.description: Numerical identifier unique to the shop. A number is sequential and starts at 1000

order_number.description: A unique numeric identifier for the order. This one is used by the shop owner and customer. This is different from the id property, which is also a unique numeric identifier for the order, but used for API purposes

processed_at.description: The date and time when the order was imported, in ISO 8601 format

processing_method.description: States the type of payment processing method

shipping_lines.description: An array of shipping_line objects, each of which details the shipping methods used.

source_name.description: Where the order originated. May only be set during creation, and is not writeable thereafter. Orders created through official Shopify channels have protected values that cannot be assigned by other API clients during order creation.

subtotal_price.description: Price of the order before shipping and taxes

tags.description: Tags are additional short descriptors, commonly used for filtering and searching, formatted as a string of comma-separated values

tax_lines.description: An array of tax_line objects, each of which details the total taxes applicable to the order.When creating an order through the API, tax lines may be specified on the order or the line items but not both

taxes_included.description: States whether or not taxes are included in the order subtotal

total_discounts.description: The total amount of the discounts to be applied to the price of the order

total_line_items_price.description: The sum of all the prices of all the items in the order

total_price.description: The sum of all the prices of all the items in the order, taxes and discounts included (must be positive)

total_tax.description: The sum of all the taxes applied to the order (must be positive)

total_weight.description: The sum of all the weights of the line items in the order, in grams.

shipping_address.description: The mailing address to where the order will be shipped. This address is optional and will not be available on orders that do not require one

app_id.description: Unique identifier of the app who created the order

order_status_url.description: The URL pointing to the order status web page. The URL will be null unless the order was created from a checkout

user_id.description: Only present on orders processed at point of sale. The unique numerical identifier for the user logged into the terminal at the time the order was processed at

cancel_reason.description: The reason why the order was cancelled. If the order was not cancelled, this value is null.If the order was cancelled, the value will be one of the customer,fraud,inventory,declined,other

browser_ip.description: The IP address of the browser used by the customer when placing the order

cancelled_at.description: The date and time when the order was cancelled. If the order was cancelled, the API returns this value in ISO 8601 format. If the order was not cancelled, this value is null.

cart_token.description: Unique identifier for a particular cart that is attached to a particular order

client_details.description: An object containing information about the client

closed_at.description: The date and time when the order was closed.If the order was not closed, this value is null

customer_locale.description: The two or three letter language code, optionally followed by a region modifier

landing_site.description: The URL for the page where the buyer landed when entering the shop

location_id.description: Only present on orders processed at point of sale. The unique numeric identifier for the physical location at which the order was processed

referring_site.description: The website that the customer clicked on to come to the shop
